description:
This market will resolve to the length of the longest continuous applause during Donald Trump’s 2026 State of the Union address, scheduled for February 24, 2026. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Only applause from individuals clapping their hands together will qualify. Other gestures, such as nodding, standing without clapping, or tapping hands on a surface, will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only applause from the start of when Trump begins audibly speaking at the podium during his speech until the moment he finishes will qualify. Applause directly before or after will NOT qualify. 

If the reported duration falls exactly between two brackets, this market will resolve to the higher bracket.

If the 2026 address to Congress address does not occur by March 31, 2026, at 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to the lowest bracket.

The resolution source will be the C-SPAN video feed listed here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5FT3FCOcRjE&pp=0gcJCYcKAYcqIYzv

events.title: Longest applause at State of the Union?

question: Will the longest continuous applause at the 2026 State of the Union address last between 70 and 90 seconds?
